discussion.content: ACD you can import usage manually user transform map to the samp_sw_usage table, but you will need publish, year, product, month, user, and ci as colease. You cant have same user for same year, month for same product

questions.question_text: Software usage data can be imported utilizing:
Which of the following statements is incorrect with regards to on-premise import and export of Content Service data?

choices.B: On-premise instances do not receive automatic Software Library updates.
choices.E: You must opt-in to the SAM Content Service through the Content Service setup page.
choices.D: By default, you are opted in to the Manage On-Premise Library (com.sn_samp_on_prem) plugin.
choices.A: Clicking on the “Manage Software Library” module takes the user to an interceptor page where they can select to import or export data.
choices.C: Normalization content is eligible for the export feature.

discussion.content: I think it's D cause it's not active by default

Selected Answer: D
Its D, by default you are opted out. The whole Now Learning topic about this is just 'Why should you opt in?' lol

Selected Answer: D
D. By default, you are opted in to the Manage On-Premise Library (com.sn_samp_on_prem) plugin.

is incorrect. By default, you are not opted in to the Manage On-Premise Library (com.sn_samp_on_prem) plugin. You would typically need to opt-in or activate such plugins in ServiceNow.

Selected Answer: E
From Now learning document
To participate in this service, you must opt-in. You can exclude specific software discovery models from being provided to ServiceNow on the Software Discovery Model form.
By default, you are opted out.
Therefore E is correct?

comments.content: I think you may be a little confused on the question. The correct answer would in fact be D because it is asking which answer choice is INCORRECT. That being said you are absolutely correct that you are opted out by default. Making D the most accurate choice in this question.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The right answer is A: Reject to not create a record, if "ignore" is selected, the record will still me created.

create: Create a new choice or record in the reference table.
ignore: Ignore the new value from the source table.
reject: Skip the entire row (record) containing the new value and continue to the next row.

The question is not clear about what record should not be created as in this scenario the transform would be creating two records, not one. 

There are two possibilities:
- If the transforms target record should not be created, then Reject is the correct answer as this will stop the creation of the new choice or reference data and also block the insert of the target record
- If the target choice or reference records should not be created, then Ignore would be a more appropriate option. This would allow the insert of the target record but block the insert of the new choice/reference data and leave the associated field on the target record empty. Reject would also work here but that would be throwing the baby out with the bath water.

Delete is not a valid choice and Create is the happy path where you want to insert the related record

A. Reject will skip the record. 
Ignore will create a record, but leave the field empty or filled with default value.

Selected Answer: D
Correct Answer D
Ignore, ignores the value
Reject, rejects the whole row

questions.question_text: If a value from an import does not exist in ServiceNow and the import should not create a new record, which option should be selected?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
As best practice, download the import template each time you import as there may be changes from release to release

Selected Answer: C
Explanation in SAM Fundamentals
Correct answer is C. The first tab contains the instructions for how to fill out the template.

choices.C: Ensure you have downloaded and used the latest version of the template file
choices.B: Ensure the entitlement data is listed on the first tab of the template file
choices.D: Ensure you have the sam_user role assigned to you
choices.A: Ensure you have filled out every field in the template file

questions.question_text: What is a first key step prior to uploading your entitlement import data via the ServiceNow-provided template?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Content Data Services: provides continual software recognition improvement based on your Discovery data. By default, you are opted out, you only receive normalization service updates from other sources. When opted in, you can exclude specific software Discovery models from being provided to ServiceNow by checking the ‘Exclude from content service’ check box on the Discovery model form.

questions.question_text: The Software Asset Management Content Service is automatically enabled and cannot be opted out.
